attributes.action: Revisit the NHS Pay Deal 2018 as the initial communications were misleading
attributes.background: The detail released to NHS staff and Unions from NHS Employers was misleading and staff and unions have voted based on the information initially provided. This has resulted in large numbers of staff not receiving a 6% pay increase over 3 years as communicated.

attributes.action: Build animal bridges over country roads to stop them being killed in the 1000's
attributes.background: Living in the countryside it breaks my heart to see dead birds, deer, foxes, rabbits and badgers dead on the road. Animals just trying to live in a world that we have added thousands of cars to. They are being punished by humans. We already rule the world. Save the wildlife while there's time
attributes.additional_details: A65 is a prime example of this in Cumbria. Every single day there is a dead animal on this road. And most other roads around these parts. It's disgusting how we destroy every we touch let alone what we are doing to the animals. Finding a half dead mangled deer at the side of the road and having to put it out of its misery is the worst thing I've had to do and it's not the first one. Please get on board

attributes.action: Allow student nurses to receive 4 yearly instalments of their maintenance loan.
attributes.background: Most academic years of degrees start at mid to late September and end in May meaning three yearly instalments is ok for them. Nursing students don't end until August and start their next year in the same month! They are expected to survive on the same as those who aren't in the same situations.
attributes.additional_details: Three instalments does not give a student nurse enough support to fund their accommodation or basic health and wellbeing!

attributes.action: Make March 29th a public holiday from March 29th 2019
attributes.background: this is the day we officially leave the EU therefore it is only fitting that one of the most important days in modern history is marked as a national holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaker John Bercow said the EU (Withdrawal) Bill, which repeals the 1972 European Communities Act through which Britain became a member of the bloc, had received royal assent from Queen Elizabeth II.

The bill transfers decades of European law onto British statute books, and also enshrines Brexit day in British law as March 29, 2019 at 11pm (2300 GMT) -- midnight Brussels time.

Prime Minister Theresa May said the approval was a "historic moment for our country, and a significant step towards delivering on the will of the British people".

attributes.action: Ban the sale of rat poison to prevent its misuse to protect other animals
attributes.background: There are frequent cases of the misuse of rat poison resulting in the poisoning of dogs, cats and other animals. There are other ways in which rats can be controlled so I would like to see the sale and use of Rat Poison banned.
attributes.additional_details: A simple search of the internet will find multiple cases.

attributes.action: Keep Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses
attributes.background: Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses are only allowed by certain Councils at the moment. Because you mention a Circus has Animals in it certain Councils want to Ban them i hope my Petition will stop this from happening and let this tradition continue
attributes.additional_details: Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses could range from Dogs, Cats to Budgies and Horses that come from Outside the UK that forms part of a Travelling Circuses Act and will only be allowed if the Animals coming into the UK have been Inspected by the RSPCA/SSPCA etc and only then will Horses from outside be allowed in Travelling Circuses.

attributes.action: Call on Parliament to censure President Trump for his policy choices
attributes.background: We call on Parliament to use the opportunity of President Trump's visit to the UK to condemn in the strongest terms his policy choices. We ask that Parliament pass a motion which makes clear our opposition to his regressive policies.
attributes.additional_details:
The Muslim ban. Separating families at the border. Pulling out of the Paris agreement and the Iran deal. Starting trade wars. His approach to the media. Saying there were 'fine people on both sides' following the white nationalist rally in Charlottesville. His response to NFL protests against police violence. These are just a handful of the President's political choices that many people in the UK find troubling. 

We call on our representatives to make clear that we do not support these views.

attributes.action: Place a price ceiling on the cost of therapeutic oxygen for inflight use.
attributes.background: I suffer from a collection of  congenital heart defects which means that I require the use of therapeutic oxygen when I fly on an aircraft. The cost of this is upwards from £50 per flight. Some airlines ask you to provide your own oxygen through a private company which costs around £300 per week.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that the travel industry is capitalising on peoples illnesses, and receiving a huge profit on the sale of therapeutic oxygen, which is essential a bottle of air, as medical grade oxygen is available to purchase for £6.64 on the BOC website. 
https://www.boconline.co.uk/shop/en/uk/healthcare/medical-gas/oxygen-cylinder-medical-grade-compressed-gas
 I am calling for a price limit to be placed on therapeutic inflight oxygen as it is unfair for the industry to make money off my illness.

attributes.action: FREE sanitary products for women with endometriosis
attributes.background: 1 in 10 women of reproductive age in the UK suffer from endometriosis. 10% of women world wide have endometriosis - that's 176 million worldwide. Women with endometriosis usually experience extremely heavy and painful periods and can go through as many as 20 night time pads in an average day.

attributes.action: The country needs more Social Housing
attributes.background: In London the average waiting time for Social Housing is 10 years. For families that are in financial difficulties, this is a long wait. They will be moved around areas,moving from one temporary property to another. To fix this issue we need more Social housing across the country.
attributes.additional_details: According to The Guardian: The idea of affordable housing has been 'twisted and out of shape'

attributes.action: Do not remain in the EEA
attributes.background:
Remaining in the EEA will stop the UK becoming the sovereign nation that was voted for in the referendum.
All the promises of new trade deals will become token at best.
Nations outside of the EU has warned against staying in the EU like this and we demand parliament does as was told by the people.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/alexander-downer-warns-uk-of-irrelevancy-over-soft-brexit-plans/news-story/c967595695165c994395d81fbb91e100

attributes.action: Lower car tax and fuel benefit for diesel company cars after this years tax hike
attributes.background: The company car has become a cash cow for the government over the last few years. Many field representatives earn modest salaries, and have job cars where they have no choice of  model, engine type, etc. I would like to see the system made more fair after this years massive increase in tax.

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers include the potassium content and Phosphate on labels.
attributes.background: People with Heart/Renal problems need to be mindful of the food they are eating making sure they do not consume to much potassium and phosphate, however this information is largely unknown by the manufacture. This petition aims to make the food manufacturers make this information readily available.

attributes.action: Establish 14th March as a public holiday
attributes.background: On the passing of Stephen Hawking establish a day on which to honour him and all the nation's mathematicians and scientists (eg Newton, Halley, Babbage, Lovelace, Somerville, Berners-Lee etc etc); to fall within UK Science Week; coinciding with Pi Day. .
attributes.additional_details: A public holiday to be observed on the 14th March, a day given to discussion, deliberation, display and development of science and to encourage involvement and understanding by all

attributes.action: To implement a fishery licence to shoot a maximum of 3 otters a year.
attributes.background:
The current growth rate and lack of food for the otter has ment many well stocked fisheries to now be under attack. 
The otter while understandably protected, has outgrown its surroundings and is now ruining livelihoods of a multi billion pound industry.
attributes.additional_details:
There is so many videos of otter damage to fish, birds and wild life something has to be done to protect, 
1. Fish stocks in rivers
2. Bird life on nature reserves and rivers 
3. Fishery livelihoods. 
The continuing release of otters since 1999 has grown.
Earsham 2006 149 otters released 
And many more have been released under the radar.  
Many expensive carp have fallen victim to the otter and has cost many fisheries thousands of pounds in otter fencing where allowed and replacement of fish.

attributes.action: Make it an offence for people who park in parent & child spaces without child
attributes.background: Having a child myself when out and about is stressful enough. When you come to park your car in parent & child space it would be nice not to see so many people using the spaces that are reserved for people who have children.
attributes.additional_details:
This morning I witnessed 3 different cars parked in the parent and child spaces after I drove round for 5 minutes trying to find one. Eventually I saw a lone lady get into her car who didn’t have a child. She eventually pulled out the space and whilst I was unloading the pushchair, the car that was parked next to me, had four adults walk to it and get in.
It’s extremley useful to have the extra space either side of the car when you have a car seat to get out.

attributes.action: Stop childcare providers charging parents when they are closed or have holiday.
attributes.background: This is a petition to stop parents being held to ransom by childcare providers! Currently nurseries/child minders are allowed to charge parents up to a full days rate for care when they are closed for bank holidays, staff training and xmas. Resulting in working parents taking holiday or upaid leave.

attributes.action: Legalise bow hunting in the UK
attributes.background:
I am petitioning as a fellow bowman to relegalise bow hunting. It has been a skillful way of supplying meat since the ancient times.

But now, in the UK, it is all done by guns, and bows are no longer legal. There is neither any explanation as to why it is illegalised. But we can change that.
attributes.additional_details:
The difference between guns and bows are as follows;
Bullets can get lost in your game, only to be found painfully when eating the game - Arrows get taken out soon after game is caught.
Guns are loud, scaring the animal before it dies - Bows are not as loud, if without silencers, still allowing a more humane hunt.
Gun fumes and bullet/shell remains are pollutable - Arrows are collected if found.
Bows are lighter but more convenient to that of loading a gun, which emmits noise.

attributes.action: Increase limit for when charities must have an independent review of accounts
attributes.background: I am involved with a charity which makes approximately £25-£30k per year, meaning we must have an independent review.  This cost us £2500 this year, which seems a disproportionately high percentage of our income.   Increasing the limit to £50k could help charities give more to the causes we support.
attributes.additional_details: According to gov.uk, there were approximately 58 thousand charities in the UK with income between £10k and £100k.  If we assume that these are evenly distributed across the range, around 16000 charities would benefit.  If their costs are similar to ours, that would be an extra £45k going to good cause each year.  While transparency is important, people give to small charities assuming the money goes to the cause they promote and 10% going to an auditor does not serve their expectations well.

attributes.action: Beat corporate tax avoidance by introducing Sales Tax based on Delivery Address
attributes.background: Big companies like Amazon, with turnovers in the UK in the billions, get away with paying next to no corporation tax.  Introduce a Delivery Sales Tax, based on the postcode being delivered to.  Claw back this money which is currently flowing overseas.  We could do this by monitoring at the courier.
attributes.additional_details:
It would be simple to legislate to require delivery companies to keep a log of:

a) Origin Company
b) Delivery Postcode
c) Declared value of item
d) Unique Shipping ID

Issue each company with an annual tax bill based on a fair percentage of the total value of all items delivered in the UK.

Failure to declare adequate value of a package would invalidate its insurance.

Spot checks would be simple - make occasional test orders to random addresses.  Incorrect declarations would be fined harshly.

attributes.action: Give the parents of twins or multiples maternity leave per child
attributes.background: Currently the parents of twins, triplets, quads etc. Only receive one years maternity leave for one parent. We feel parents should receive maternity leave per child.

attributes.action: Bring Welfare Assessments back to the DWP and scrap contracts with providers
attributes.background: There are widespread reports of Capita producing PIP and ESA assessments that are inaccurate, contain factual errors and ignore important evidence. There are too many appeals being lost by the DWP because of Capita's incompetence.
attributes.additional_details: People are being made seriously ill as a result of the appalling record of Capita’s assessments. It seems Capita make headlines about errors and omissions in all their govt contracts but the most serious is their atrocious record in Welfare assessments.

attributes.action: Don't sell Linton-on-ouse
attributes.background: Keep RAF Linton on ouse open it's the best fast jet training facility

attributes.action: Require 70% of National Park members be directly elected, 30% being appointees.
attributes.background: Residents of Parks have no vote on the policies and expenditure that affect much of their daily lives and yet they are taxpayers.  All present members are appointees who have no manifesto and no mandate; further, many appear as sinecures given to loyal foot-soldiers across the political spectrum.
attributes.additional_details: Members of the National Parks Authorities are each appointed by one of 3 routes: by the SoS; by local authorities overlapping a Park; by amalgams of Park Parishes.  Much as the power devolved to a Park is supposedly limited to Planning and environmental protection, by the control of funds and staff, the Authorities have more all-pervasive impacts on the lives of residents of the Parks than their local authorities that tax them.  The proposed 30%, SoS appointees represent special-interests.

attributes.action: law to put panic buttons in hgv s incase drivers have medical emergency
attributes.background: Lots of drivers going missing and when found are deceased in their cabs, either unable to raise alarm of feeling unwell or no signal on phone etc

attributes.action: Alll people charged with a sexual offence against children remanded in custody.
attributes.background: Children are our future. The most valuable people in society. If the CPS deems enough evidence to charge offenders exist, that means they are a danger to all children. Which means they should be on remand until their court case. No bail can circumvent this risk. No prison spaces? Build new prisons.

attributes.action: Parents must be told if the other parent is convicted of child sex offenses
attributes.background: Parents must be told if their ex is convicted of child sex offenses, even if they don’t have contact with the children at that time.

attributes.action: Make gay conversion therapy a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Gay conversion therapy is currently legal in the UK

No one should be told that their sexual orientation, their identity, is a an illness that needs to be cured.
attributes.additional_details:
Following a journalist's report on gay conversion therapy at a church in Liverpool the government has devised a 75 point action plan to improve the lives of the LGBT community. The plan states that the government will set out to ban such therapies but doesn't say how this is going to be enforced.

You can't simply just tell people not to do something and hope that it works, because it doesn't. Something more needs to be done. We urge the government to criminalise gay conversion therapy.

attributes.action: British National (Overseas) Citizens should be given full British Citizenship.
attributes.background: People in Hong Kong who hold the British National (Overseas) passport are British; however, the British government is refusing and avoiding giving these Hong Kongers the right of abode in the United Kingdom nor in any of the British territories. Many of them were forced to become PROC Chinese.
attributes.additional_details: The Chinese government is ignoring the Sino Anglo Agreements signed in 1981. It could be a disaster if we keep ignoring this is happening. Hong Kongers will come in as political refugees. We will need a lot of effort to house them and bad for the British reputations to the International community then.

attributes.action: 6 points on the persons driving licence if caught leaving a dog in a hot car
attributes.background: People who leave their dogs in baking hot cars should be disciplined with 6 points on their driving licence and reported directly to the RSPCA.

attributes.action: Male Suicide Prevention Strategy
attributes.background: According to the ONS, "of the 5,965 suicides registered in 2016, a total of 4,508 were male and 1,457 were female." We call on HM Government to take urgent and meaningful action to identify main factors that contribute to men in the UK being three times more likely to commit suicide than women.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the PM to establish a panel on Male Suicide Prevention, whose job would be to undertake public consultation and produce a comprehensive report on male suicide in the UK; with key findings and recommendations leading to the publication of the Government's first ever UK-wide Male Suicide Prevention Strategy.

"The fall in suicide rates from 2015 to 2016 is the largest decrease in 20 years. It fell for both males and females in the UK, although men still account for 3/4 of all suicides."

attributes.action: Withdraw the sovereignty of the U.S embassy & send the U.S ambassadors home
attributes.background: In light of the atrocities carried out by Donald Trump's administration in the name of "strong borders" we must not tolerate the human rights abuses carried out against migrant children and their families, it is clear we must cut all ties with America.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is evidence of the crimes against immigrants held in detention centres.
https://www.thecut.com/2018/06/immigrant-children-detention-center-separated-parents.html
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/us-immigration-children-audio-trump-border-patrol-separate-families-parents-detention-center-a8405501.html
https://www.thecut.com/2018/06/immigrant-children-allegedly-drugged-abused-in-shelters.html
What is happening to these children and their families is abhorrent.

attributes.action: Re-think the current legislation criminalising cannabis.
attributes.background: The governments response to a similar petition stated that they are basing policy on a 10 year old report done under labour, I'm asking the government to re-think this policy by conducting a new, up to date and relevant study to bring our legislation up to modern standards.

attributes.action: Make public stadiums and arenas ban or charge for single use plastic cups.
attributes.background: Make all stadiums, public arenas and any venue using plastic cups/bottles either ban the use of these and use a paper alternative or have a deposit scheme where a charge is applied for anyone using a plastic cup/bottle and is refunded when the cup/bottle is returned.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic takes between 500-1000 years to degrade.

50% of sea turtles have consumed plastic.

1,000,000 sea birds and 100,000 marine animals are killed each year due to plastic waste.

There is more micro-plastic in the sea then stars in the Milky Way.

Single use bags, Straws, cups and bottle are the most common type of plastic pollution found in the ocean.

All the plastic that has ever been made is still around in one shape or another (excluding that which has been incinerated)

attributes.action: Debate the impact of Trump's visit on the UK's security and reputation
attributes.background: Since moving into the White House, Mr Trump has shown an impatience bordering on intolerance toward peaceful protests, the media and even the democratic process itself. So his visit to Britain will be an important opportunity to underline the importance of free speech and the right to protest.

attributes.action: An accepted offer on a house is a binding contract, withdrawal incurs 5% penalty
attributes.background: When we bought our house, the vendor withdrew at the last minute and selling our current house, more than one buyer withdrew at the last minute and in each case, leaving us with considerable inconvenience and unforeseen financial consequences. This will stop chains collapsing.

attributes.action: Change planning laws. Everyone should have a say and be heard.
attributes.background: If a local resident affected by a planning application requests a meeting, planning officers and councillors must meet them to discuss their concerns before a decision is made. Council officers discuss planning applications for months with developers and their army of planning consultants.
attributes.additional_details: They must talk to us as well. The current situation is fundamentally undemocratic and wrong. A developer made a planning application for a supermarket down my little street. There is no parking, huge lorries will make deliveries and we were concerned our tiny road would not be big enough. Nobody in planning would listen to us. Elected councillors refused to discuss the planning application. My objection comments went unread: I was denied a voice: I was silenced.

attributes.action: Commemorate the life of Stephen Hawking with a day of national mourning.
attributes.background:
One of the greatest minds of his generation.
A national treasure.
Influential for years to come.

attributes.action: Do not impose same-sex marriage on religious minorities
attributes.background: We call on Parliament, now and in the future, to continue to uphold the fundamental human right of religious minorities (Christians, Muslims, Jews and others) not to have same-sex marriage imposed on us, as guaranteed by the so-called ‘quadruple lock’ in the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013.
attributes.additional_details:
The right of religious minorities not to have same-sex marriage imposed on them was guaranteed by the so-called ‘quadruple lock’ which was included in the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013 when same-sex marriage was legalized in the UK.

We call on Parliament to continue to uphold and respect this fundamental human right.

We remind Parliament that one of its key functions in a democratic society is to protect minorities from the ‘tyranny of the majority.’

attributes.action: Make it law for all restaurants to provide Braille menus.
attributes.background: Why should people not have the option to read a menu? Perhaps it's something that we sighted people take for granted. In order for visually impaired people to gain more independence, it's important that they're actually able to read a menu for themselves.

attributes.action: Introduce National Conscription with the opportunity to volunteer overeseas.
attributes.background: It seems it would be more constructive to direct school leavers at 16 or 18 to have the opportunity to be part of a group who provide the opportunity to engage in social positive role model building than to be unemployed and idle when so much help is needed across society. A better use of gov money.
attributes.additional_details: Knife crime, scooter mugging, drug taking and obesity are all escalating issues amongst young people both as perpetrators and victims. National Conscription for one year with the opporuntiy to volunteer abroad could be such a constructive initiative following the lead of Norway, Denmark and Israel - three of the happiest, most disciplined, best-educated countries in the world. Germany, France and Italy are considering something similar.

attributes.action: Give EU citizens working in the NHS free indefinite leave to remain in the UK.
attributes.background:
The possibility of a "no-deal" Brexit has been described as uncomfortably high. 
There are a significant number of EU citizens working in the NHS.  Any disruption in their working rights may have catastrophic effects. The government should give them indefinite leave to remain for free.
attributes.additional_details:
There are more than 60,000 NHS staff who are EU citizens. At present, there is no assurance that they can continue working post Brexit. This makes recruitment of staff challenging. 
The suggested £65 fee represents more than one day's earnings for the majority of them and cannot be justified for administration purposes.

attributes.action: Remove the 2 year restriction on a 125cc motorcycle upon completion of the CBT.
attributes.background: If you can ride a 125cc for 2 years why not permanently.

attributes.action: Do not endorse Zimbabwe’s harmonised 2018 elections
attributes.background: There is growing evidence that the outcome of Zimbabwe’s harmonised elections was not a result of a free and fair electoral process. This was followed by post-election violence and the alleged slaughter and beatings of civilians by the army.
attributes.additional_details:
Abductions and an intensified crackdown on the opposition is ongoing.

As an activist, and with many Zimbabweans I am appealing to the UK parliament and government to: - suspend further economic, bilateral engagement with Zimbabwe's govt until there is clarity on its human rights situation; -recognise the unsafe political environment in Zimbabwe for opposition and activists; -strongly support concerns raised by EU, Zimbabwe Human Rights Groups and the USA on elections in Zimbabwe; put pressure on Zimbabwe's govt to account for the killing of innocent civilians by the army.

attributes.action: Amend the Official Secrets Act to prevent its use in cases of child abuse.
attributes.background: The Official Secrets Act may have deterred people from whistleblowing on paedophiles in positions of power. This is contrary to the public interest. We call on the Government to amend the Act to ensure that it can’t happen again.
attributes.additional_details:
There seem to have been moves to cover up cases of child abuse in order to protect people in power from accusations. This is evidenced by the Interview former chief whip Tim Fortescue gave to Panorama in 1995.
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/28207066/abuse-claims-senior-whip-would-help-colleagues
 
I have campaigned on this issue for 30+ years

attributes.action: Murdered 4 y/o British national: Urge Pakistani government to deliver justice
attributes.background: This murder has been overlooked for 4 years. Shahryar Ahmad, a British national, was kidnapped outside his grandmother's home in Faisalabad, Pakistan on 21 August 2014, and subsequently murdered by the gang who abducted him.
attributes.additional_details: I, Iftkhar Ahmad, Shahryar's father,  was led to believe for almost 4 months that the kidnappers were holding him for ransom, however it was later discovered that my little boy’s body was found by the police, dumped in a canal a mere 2 days after his abduction. Justice has not been delivered to Shahryar or my family. Urgent intervention by the UK government and parliament is necessary.

attributes.action: The practice of unsolicited credit limit increases should be banned.
attributes.background: The Financial Conduct Authority has limited the use of unsolicited credit card limit increases, but it is not enough. There are still people actively being given these when there is no hope of them paying them off if they used them.
attributes.additional_details:
The FCA reports: "Our analysis of 2014 data showed that receiving a credit limit increase is associated with an increase in spending, with accounts that received a credit limit increase having an average balance £458 higher at the end of the year. The average credit limit increase was £1,321."

The finance industry is therefore actively encouraging people to spend more money and get further into debt. 

https://www.fca.org.uk/publication/consultation/cp17-43.pdf

attributes.action: Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges while on duty.
attributes.background:
Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges.

Lights and/or siren not required to be active for exemption.

Only requirement is for staff to be on duty (on call) but not restricted to being on a call and is to include brake times.
attributes.additional_details: www.express.co.uk/news/uk/993969/parking-warden-ticket-paramedics-north-west-ambulance-service/amp

attributes.action: Raise  Housing Benefits in accordance with Market Prices
attributes.background: The benefits system offers a miserly level of rent , expecting recipients to  manage in a housing market with prices far outstripping the benefit available.
attributes.additional_details: It is virtually impossible to find a home at the price the government claims is available for renting. Recipients are penalised for renting a place with two beds, even when one beds are limited, and many people cannot meet the cost of rent in this country. This is forcing many people into homelessness and rewarding greedy private landlords, while many renters are trying to meet excess costs out of their limited finances. Market value is not being taken into account where Housing Benefits are concerned.  Social Housing and cheap, good homes are not available, and market costs are ridiculously high, resulting in a dismal market, and a head in the clouds response from the government in tackling the housing crisis on all levels. Raise the level of Housing Benefit in line with the market.

attributes.action: Make all goods vehicles to have speed limiters set at the national speed limit
attributes.background: Legislation needs to be in place making all goods vehicles speed limiters set at the national speed limit in order to reduce overtaking . At present hauliers set their vehicles at a speed of their choice. This causes bunching of LGV's and causes unnecessary overtaking .
